name: "D" Ye Want to Take This Bible Quiz? | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: Joshua 19:10-11 starts to tell where the children of Zebulun's land was. What D-place is mentioned in the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Dabbasheth.

	Dabbasheth means "she knows" or "flowing with honey". Dabbasheth is on the river Jokneam.

questions.text: What was the name of the Philistines god as mentioned in Judges 16:23, according to the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Dagon.

	The Philistines were offering a sacrifice to Dagon because they believe they defeated Samson. However, God gave Samson strength one last time. Samson pushed away the pillars causing the building to collapse killing all the Philistines in the building and Samson himself.

questions.text: In Mark 8:10 of the KJV, where did Jesus and His disciples go via ship?
questions.explanation:
Dalmanutha.

	Jesus and the His disciples went after He miraculously fed 4000 people with 5 loaves of bread and 2 fishes. Jesus often would go off either alone or with His disciples after performing miracles. It is believed that Dalmanutha might be what is now known as Migdal located in Israel's Ginosar Valley.

questions.text: Where was Daniel (from the book of Daniel) from?
questions.explanation:
Judah.

	Daniel is one of the best known characters in the Bible. In chapter 1 he is given the Babylon name Belteshazzar. In chapter 2, David interprets Nebuchadnezzar's dream, making Nebuchadnezzar have new found respect for Daniel's God. In chapter 6, Daniel is thrown into the lion's den but is not eaten by the lions. You can read about these and the other adventures of Daniel in the book of Daniel which has 12 chapters.

Darius.

	Darius is the one who had Daniel thrown into the lion's den for praying to God. After Daniel was saved, Darius made a proclamation that from now on, all people were to pray only to Daniel's God.

questions.text: Who were the sons of Eliab?
questions.explanation:
Dathen and Abiram.

	Dathen and his family had a problem with God and Moses.  So, after giving him many chances, God opened up the earth and it swallowed up Dashen and his family. You can read about this in Deuteronomy 11:6 (KJV) and Psalm 106:17 (KJV). There is also things written about Dathen in the book of Numbers, mainly in chapter 16.

questions.text: When is the first time the Devil is mentioned in the New Testament using the name Devil in the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Matthew 4:1.

	Matthew 4 is when the Devil tempts Jesus three times. First, he told him if he was truly the Son of God to turn the stones into bread. Despite having not eaten in 40 days, Jesus resisted the Devil. The second time the Devil took him to the top of the temple and dared him to throw Himself down saying angels would catch him. Again, Jesus resisted. The final temptation was when the Devil promised everything in the world to Jesus if He would bow down to the Devil. And, yet again, Jesus resisted. You can read about this in Matthew 4:1-11.

questions.text: What does Jeremiah 17:1 say were written with the point of a diamond?
questions.explanation:
the sins of Judah.

	It says, "The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars." God went on to curse men who puts his trust in man instead of God.

Didymus.

	Both names mean "twin". He is often referred to as "Doubting Thomas" as well because he refused to believe it was Jesus after Jesus rose from the dead until he could see the scars for himself.

Doctor of the Law.

	He was also a Pharisee. In the book of Acts, he warned people to stay away from the disciples.
